chunks.text: Now what Jango does is, it finds out which resource you want to access from where you got the request

chunks.text: Like you accessed the slash login, slash register, slash tweet, slash one, whatever the tweet ID is, you accessed it

chunks.title: Templates and errors in Django
chunks.text: On that basis, Jango has an internal URL resolver

chunks.title: Templates and errors in Django
chunks.text: This URL resolver doesn't do anything, it just resolves the URL

chunks.text: Whether you want to log in or slash where you want to go

text: Hello, how are you all? Welcome to Chai and Code, our unique YouTube channel If you haven't subscribed to our channel yet, then please do it now Tell your friends to subscribe to our channel so that we can bring more interesting videos We are running a Jango series right now The rest of the videos are on a different channel This video is a part of the Jango series In the last video, we saw how Jango is set up We used UV, which is quite modern, popular and fast We saw about the file structure, how the settings are, the URL files and many more In this video, we will see how the flow structure of Jango is so that you don't face any problems in the application No matter how complex the application is, the flow of Jango is exactly the same I have made a diagram for you, we will understand it slowly After that, we will implement the diagram in the code so that we can understand the flow and structure It's a fun video, you will enjoy it I am taking the target of 300 comments, hopefully you will complete it as soon as possible Let's share the screen and discuss the diagram first Because it is a very fun diagram We will not see this diagram completely, we will see it one by one I will put it aside so that you don't face any problem Jango is a web framework All the web frameworks use a tech stack under the hood So that they can find out about the request, response, browser, etc. By default, Python can't find out which request you have, which response you have There are some event triggers that do this work behind the scenes We have a very simple flow, Jango doesn't have a thousand things It's just a simple flow, 3 or 4 things are involved in it That's it, and they are always involved That's why Jango is so reliable and fast This is your user They need a request response model That means they have a website, either they want to log in to it or see a tweet or something like that So they fired their browser and sent a request directly Now this request goes to a website Now behind the scenes, there is Nginx, Kadi, any server running on the website We don't have anything to do with it When we deploy, we will see that thing So this request goes to Jango Now what Jango does is, it finds out which resource you want to access from where you got the request Like you accessed the slash login, slash register, slash tweet, slash one, whatever the tweet ID is, you accessed it On that basis, Jango has an internal URL resolver This URL resolver doesn't do anything, it just resolves the URL Whether you want to log in or slash where you want to go You never come to this URL resolver, 99% chance that you will never see it or access it This core is inbuilt in Jango We don't see this file, nor do we have access to it by default We get it if we want, but we don't come to it This URL resolver finally accesses another file, which is called URL.py So we have this request from here The request says, resolve the URL and see where it should go Then we get the URL.py file Now this URL.py file, we saw here The way we had slash admin, we can have more resolvers of URL But it's not necessary that you always come to this URL.py, this main file Many times this URL file redirects you to another Like I told you, Jango can have multiple small apps So this URL.py can further redirect you to another URL file Consider it as a modular code, not a big deal So it's possible that you came here, it's possible that URL.py sent you directly here Now this URL.py file sends you to a file called views.py Now this views.py file is not visible anywhere But it's not that it doesn't exist, we can make it if we want So I have Jango, remember where I am, what is my level, see that Here I am in my project, this is my complete directory Project is in the directory I opened this, I will make a new file here so that we can understand it I made this views.py, it's name is views only It can't be view, it can't be my view, it can't be your view, it can't be Chai view Okay, we went to the views.py file So what does views.py file do? This is your main controller, main logic where it will be written It's possible that you have to send a response directly, welcome to Jango Or it's possible that you have to send via models.py We don't have the models file now, it will eventually come Through this, we can contact DB Or your views.py file can also contact DB It has a complete option, we have ORMs in Jango, we will discuss them too But now the main thing is that the views.py file has the access to take something from the database To save something in it, all our logic is written here Once you have written the logic, then you have to send a response to the front end And this response comes straight to Jango And Jango sends this response, that's it And sometimes it uses some templates, which we will do too And via template it sends you the response So this is a complete complex architecture that is behind the scenes in Jango Now if I want to make a small architecture of this How will we do this, it's very easy You have a user, this is our user This user sent a request, so suppose we got a request Now where will this request go, it will go to the urls.py file Who will the urls.py file call, it will call the views That's it, so let's make arrows on it The user sent a request, the request went to our url.py And the url.py sent it to the views What will the views do, it will send a response to the url So it came back to the url We will not accept the url, it will send you a response So we will send it here and take a simple response Here, the response is sent to you, that's it And this is your complete Jango That's it, in 4 lines, our Jango is complete You get a request, the request hits the urls.py The urls.py can call the views Views are different ways of how it will send you a response It may send a query from the database, it may send a direct response It may send through templates, it may send through something else This is your complete logical structure So if you ever want to understand Jango, if you understand this That's it, nothing else to do This is all the work of Jango And if you want to understand in more detail, then this is the complete structure You may have made a diagram in which you are taking your notes So this is our work Now let's follow this diagram First, we go to this views.py Because here we will write our logic So we write logic, how will we work After that we will go to urls.py Which view to hit on which url And then we will see the request response It's a very basic work So let's go to the code one So we have views.py on the code Look carefully, this is the level of views.py This level has a lot of problems The name is views.py If there is some other name, then the problem comes It's a framework, the name is restricted in the framework Okay, so you understood this Now let's go to write some code So let's write the code It's a very basic python code Hope you know python If you don't know, then you will understand a lot Many people learn python on the go So maybe this is the same phase for you So first of all, we have to take django.http Where will it come from? Import will come from http response There is also a request Now we are not on request, now we just have to give response So we got this, now you can give response As soon as you get http request or response Means you are ready to take both request and response Compared to if you are coming from any other programming language Then you have to take request, response, etc. In python, you don't have to do this Now we have to make some methods or you can say function So my first function is home You have to add request here So that you know that I have to return this home on a request And after that I said return Now what do you have to return? I have to return http response What kind of response do you have to return? Let's do one thing for now We say directly that you do a small response Which is hello world And let's say this You are at chai or django homepage Now what will I do with this line? I will copy it here because I am going to create 2-3 more responses Or I will copy and paste this whole thing That will also be fine So this is what you have Now what will you have to do in this way? In this way, you can make more routes if you want We take 2 more Let's add a gap between them So take this This route will be about The name of these methods can be anything In that case, you don't have a restriction You call it about, you call it chai about, call it superman Nobody is stopping you Yes, you can also say nagraj There is no such load in it We go to the second and write another contact page Now what do we do? Let's change it a little This is django's about page And this is our contact page Okay Now one thing is done Whatever I had to write in views I have written it now I don't have to do anything more than this Further, we do not need to export anything in python And all that is not needed So I have done a very basic job Now let's go next What do you want to do next? Next you have to handle URLs Okay So URLs are not such a big thing You can handle it easily So these are our URLs We have also given some comments here And we also get some examples That you took admin from django Admin was used here Okay Path has been used As such, no path is being used now But we still keep it Now when you have to use views Because the URL will come Then I don't know which one to hit So you have to tell in the URL Whether you want to hit the about method Or home method It is very basic So what we do here We write a path So here is our path Which path will be? Our path will be home route You write home route like this We don't do this in python Or in django specially Now we need views But we don't have views So let's import first From our current directory You import views Here are the views Now which one on this route You have to add So I have to add views Dot And you have access to different routes Home Along with this We also pass an optional parameter Which will help you a lot in the future That is name That of this entire route Or this entire method What name do you want to give I want to give its name home This last line If you don't even write Then you will not get any error But its use case We will see after a while How it comes in use That's it That's all Your URL handle is done Now you know If you want to handle about How will you do So here This is done Let's call it about And further here Let's also bring it about method And path Path is about So as above Admin is written Here is about and slash It is important to write slash Leaving home route After that Here you have contact Contact And here view b Contact Oops Contact Did we write contact there? Contact And its name will be Contact So we have this We forgot to put comma So there is no big problem Let's also put this So this is done Now we have route So this way You have routing And your homepage is done That's it That's all Now let's see How we have the matter We open our terminal here And how to run So if you know Last time we saw python And here you can do it straight Manage.py Now see carefully I am hitting tab But I am not getting manage file Why not? Because as soon as I do ls I don't have that file I have to go to that folder This is a very common mistake Please don't do it See if you have access to manage.py file Or not So we go here In Chai and Django I did ls Now I have manage.py file Who has command access Run server So we come here python And through manage.py file We call it run server As you say run server You know We will see about in migration and errors later There are no errors There is only warning For now we come to this route And access Okay You go to this url So see we reached very easily Hello world You are at Chai and Django homepage Can you see?
